headline: Massive fire erupts in jet fuel unit at Chevron's LA refinery
summary: STORY: A massive fire erupted at Chevron’s El Segundo refinery near Los Angeles on Thursday.Chevron said there were no injuries and all workers were accounted for…But it did raise questions over fuel supply in California, an isolated energy market. The fire broke out in a jet fuel production unit, which supplies the Los Angeles International Airport (LAX).It’s not immediately clear how it started. A source said it was also unclear if the incident had impacted the refinery’s ability to produce fuel - or whether fuel already stored there was affected. Tamara Smith, a local resident, said it was a scary moment.“I heard a little explosion. It sounded like the start of a 3.0 earthquake. And that was it. And then a second later, there was another loud explosion, and it felt like a 5.(0) earthquake and I thought we were actually having the start of an earthquake."It’s Chevron's second biggest refinery in the U.S.; it supplies a fifth of all motor vehicle fuels and 40% of the jet fuel consumed in southern California.Analysts said it’s unlikely to impact wider oil prices, but due to isolation from other refining centers, the state’s gasoline prices could rise.In addition to Chevron, state and federal safety agencies will investigate the fire after the blaze is extinguished.

raw.headline: Massive fire erupts in jet fuel unit at Chevron's LA refinery
raw.summary: STORY: A massive fire erupted at Chevron’s El Segundo refinery near Los Angeles on Thursday.Chevron said there were no injuries and all workers were accounted for…But it did raise questions over fuel supply in California, an isolated energy market. The fire broke out in a jet fuel production unit, which supplies the Los Angeles International Airport (LAX).It’s not immediately clear how it started. A source said it was also unclear if the incident had impacted the refinery’s ability to produce fuel - or whether fuel already stored there was affected. Tamara Smith, a local resident, said it was a scary moment.“I heard a little explosion. It sounded like the start of a 3.0 earthquake. And that was it. And then a second later, there was another loud explosion, and it felt like a 5.(0) earthquake and I thought we were actually having the start of an earthquake."It’s Chevron's second biggest refinery in the U.S.; it supplies a fifth of all motor vehicle fuels and 40% of the jet fuel consumed in southern California.Analysts said it’s unlikely to impact wider oil prices, but due to isolation from other refining centers, the state’s gasoline prices could rise.In addition to Chevron, state and federal safety agencies will investigate the fire after the blaze is extinguished.

headline: U.S. Stocks Open Higher as Shutdown Enters Day Three
summary: STOCKS  Stocks inched higher early Friday, even as the government shutdown enters a third day. The September jobs report, originally slated for Friday morning, is delayed due to the shutdown. Traders have raised bets on a lengthy stoppage.

headline: Applied Materials, Chevron, Cracker Barrel: Trending Tickers
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Applied Materials (AMAT) warning of a $600 million hit to its full-year sales tied to US-China restrictions, a fire breaking out at Chevron's (CVX) oil refinery in Los Angeles, and Crack Barrel Old Country Store (CBRL) cutting ties with the ad firm behind its controversial logo change. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Massive explosion starts fire at Chevron refinery
summary: The Chevron (CVX) oil refinery in Los Angeles was rocked by a huge explosion that resulted in a fire breaking out. Live feeds showed the fire continuing to burn for several hours. For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

headline: Top Dividend Stocks To Consider In October 2025
summary: As of October 2025, U.S. stock markets have been on an upward trajectory, with major indices like the Dow Jones and S&P 500 setting fresh records despite concerns over a government shutdown. This resilient market environment highlights the appeal of dividend stocks, which can provide investors with a steady income stream and potential for capital appreciation even amid economic uncertainties.

headline: Oil rises 1% after fire at US refinery, set to snap four-session losing streak
summary: Brent crude futures gained 61 cents, or 1%, to $64.73 a barrel by 0658 GMT.  Potentially higher OPEC+ supply, slowing global crude refinery runs due to maintenance and a seasonal dip in demand in the months ahead are set to accelerate oil stock builds in the U.S. and elsewhere, analysts say.

headline: Large Fire Erupts at Los Angeles-Area Chevron Refinery, CBS Says
summary: Firefighters responded after multiple reports of an explosion at the El Segundo operation, south of Los Angeles airport, on Thursday evening local time, CBS reported.  LA Mayor Karen Bass said in a social media post that she had been briefed on the fire outside of the city limits, adding there was no impact on the airport at this time.  Chevron didn’t immediately respond to requests for comment.

Chevron didn’t immediately respond to requests for comment.
